Detailed Description

View displaying the waveforms of a subset of the spikes evenly spaced in time over the whole recording.

Using the spin boxes in the Parameter Bar, the user can specify which spikes to use. All modification request is sent directly to the KlustersDoc object and the view is automatically updated via KlustersView when the waveforms have been changed. If the view is active, it is also automatically updated when clusers are changed.

Author:
Lynn Hazan

void WaveformView::updateClusters ( QValueList< int > &  modifiedClusters,
bool  active,
bool  isModifiedByDeletion 
) [inline, virtual, slot]

Updates the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.

Parameters:
modifiedClusters list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
isModifiedByDeletion true if the clusters of modifiedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).

Reimplemented from ViewWidget.

void WaveformView::undoUpdateClusters ( QValueList< int > &  modifiedClusters,
bool  active 
) [inline, virtual, slot]

Updates the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

This method is call only during an undo otherwise the updateClusters is call. There are 2 functions in order to reduce the number of clusters to draw whenever possible.

Parameters:
modifiedClusters list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from ViewWidget.

void WaveformView::mouseDoubleClickEvent ( QMouseEvent *  event  )  [protected, virtual]

The view responds to a double click.

The waveforms are retrieve in case the data have changed (an other view has changed its parameters) as all the views are sharing the same data.
